item.title: "P" Ring Help
item.dc:creator: @Not_a_bot Not_a_bot
item.description:
@Not_a_bot wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:3, topic:545147”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=664028.msg4438387#msg4438387 date=1405799037]
Add them on using the OR operator.
[/quote]
It’s Logical OR operator. People may get confused with Bitwise OR.[/quote]

No one retarded would come to that conclusion…

item.title: "P" Ring Help
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Pure_:

Add them on using the OR operator.

It’s Logical OR operator. People may get confused with Bitwise OR.

Read full topic

item.title: "P" Ring Help
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Add them on using the OR operator.
so:

public boolean wearItem(int wearID, int slot) { if (wearID == 773 && (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("name1") || c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("name2") || c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("name3") || etc... )) { c.sendMessage("You Can Wear This."); return true; } // ... }

Read full topic

item.title: "P" Ring Help
item.dc:creator: @Doing_Cho21 Doing Cho2
item.description:
@Doing_Cho21 wrote:

Can you tell me whats wrong with this code. Basically, I only want a certain person other than owner to wear “P” Ring, because its already a owner item only.

[sub][/sub]public boolean wearItem(int wearID, int slot) {
if ((wearID ==773 || wearID ==773) && c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“doing cho2”)) {
c.sendMessage(“You Can Wear This.”);
return true;
}[sub][/sub]

Read full topic
